alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 5:46AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Water levels in area rivers, streams, and creeks will remain high today and tonight. High elevation snowmelt will be much slower today through Tuesday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Areas of river flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flows will remain high today and tonight. Only minor rises are expected tonight with water levels near or below flood stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 AM MDT, river gauges at numerous locations in the Lander foothills into the Wind River basin are in excess of Action Stage, indicating flows at or above bankfull. There will be minor flooding issues around Lander. Minor flooding is expected to continue for the Popo Agie and Little Wind River Drainages today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid making camp near streams or creeks.
